definition: to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: The applicants who pass the qualification pre-evaluation will receive the formal invitation for Levy.
sentences.chinese: 主办单位向资审合格的应征人发出正式邀请。

sentences.english: A few months later my younger brother enlisted as a bugler .
sentences.chinese: 几个月以后，我弟弟作为号兵应征入伍。

sentences.english: She was jumpy during her job interview because she was so nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她在应征面谈的时候心惊肉跳，因为她太紧张了。

sentences.english: He was drafted by the army and served for four years.
An unemployed man goes to try for a job with Microsoft as a Lavatory cleaner.
sentences.chinese: 一名失业的人到微软去应征一份实验室清洁员的工作。

sentences.english: Aunt Sally was to find a cook, a lot, she signed up to personal interview.
sentences.chinese: 莱莉姑姑要找个厨师，良多人应征，她要亲身面试。

sentences.english: Conclusion Generally speaking, the mental health state of enrollee is normal.
sentences.chinese: 结论应征青年的心理健康状况总体正常。

sentences.english: He applied for a job as a clerk.
No, I haven't got any dutiable things with me.
sentences.chinese: 不，我没有带任何需要交应征税的东西。

sentences.english: When he was in graduate school, he was drafted into the army and sent to fight in China.
sentences.chinese: 读研究生时，他应征入伍并被派往中国参战。

sentences.english: In countries where there is conscription men are called up at the age of eighteen．（call up men／call men up／call them up）
sentences.chinese: 在实行征兵制的国家里，18岁的男子要应征服役。

sentences.english: But as you know，we have dozens of applicants to be answered.
sentences.chinese: 但你也知道，我们还有几个应征者要面谈。

sentences.english: After graduating from college, forrest gump and enlistment to Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 在大学毕业后，阿甘又应征入伍去了越南。

sentences.english: Our company has a few openings. Why don't you apply?
sentences.chinese: 我们公司有一些职缺。你何不来应征呢？

sentences.english: It's a good time to schedule that salary review or to apply for a bigger and better-paying job.
sentences.chinese: 现在是时候重温你的工资或者应征更好的工作。

definition: to recommend oneself (for a job)
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to collect/to recruit
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to conscript
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
to levy troops/recruitment
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
announcement (written, on billboard, letter, newspaper or website)/to post information/a notice
of age/of the appropriate age
to join the army
in the newspaper
to restrict/to agree to a contract/offer/bid
to recruit/to enlist
to employ/to hire
